util.math

Class FFT

  • java.lang.Object
    • util.math.FFT
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    FFTRadix2

    public abstract class FFT
extends java.lang.Object
    A Fast Fourier Transform object
    Depending on the algorithm, it may not always work, but when it does, it guarantees O(NlogN) running time, though the constant may be bad
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    EPICI

      void ifft(double[] real, double[] imaginary)
      Inverse FFT
      Conveniently swapping the real and imaginary parts will do this
      If the FFT does not divide all values by the square root of N, these will not equal the original values

    • Method Detail

      • checkBounds

        public abstract boolean checkBounds(int length)
        Is it a valid length for this FFT?
        If not, and the user attempts to do FFT anyways, bad things happen
        Parameters:
        length - the length to check
        Returns:
        true if valid

      • fft

        public void fft(double[] real,
                double[] imaginary)
        Visible in-place FFT
        Will throw an IllegalArgumentException if the FFT cannot process the data
        Parameters:
        real - the real array
        imaginary - the matching imaginary array

      • ifft

        public void ifft(double[] real,
                 double[] imaginary)
        Inverse FFT
        Conveniently swapping the real and imaginary parts will do this
        If the FFT does not divide all values by the square root of N, these will not equal the original values
        Parameters:
        real - the real array
        imaginary - the matching imaginary array

      • fft

        public void fft(double[][] both)
        Convenience method for passing both arrays bundled in one
        Parameters:
        both - first the real array, then the imaginary array
